Age Of Empires II is a classic real-time strategy game that lets players explore the history of civilizations and build their own empire by creating armies, constructing buildings, and gathering resources. The game was developed by Ensemble Studios in 1999 and has since then become a legendary game in the strategy genre.

## Storyline

The game revolves around the concept of the feudal system in which the player controls a civilization from the Dark Age to the Imperial Age. The game campaigns take players through some of the significant historical events and battles from different civilizations around the world, including the Byzantine Empire, Mongol Empire, and many more.

## Gameplay

The game has several modes that players can choose from, including a single-player campaign, multiplayer mode, and skirmish mode. In the single-player campaign, the player assumes the role of a leader of a civilization and must complete a series of objectives to progress to the next level. The multiplayer mode allows players to play online and compete against each other, while the skirmish mode lets people play against computer-controlled opponents.

The game also has a technology tree, where players can research and upgrade their civilization's technologies, which in turn affects the units and buildings they have access to. The resources players gather, including wood, food, gold, and stone, are essential for constructing buildings and training soldiers.

## Unique features

Age of Empires II features 13 historical civilizations, each with its unique strengths and weaknesses. The game has an intricate economic system, which adds to the strategic depth of the game. The game also has four different campaign types: William Wallace (Britons), Joan of Arc (Franks), Saladin (Saracens), and Genghis Khan (Mongols), each reflecting a different story and gameplay experience.

## Conclusion

In conclusion, Age Of Empires II is an excellent example of a classic real-time strategy game. The game has stood the test of time and continues to be a favorite among veteran and novice gamers alike. The game's historical and educational context, combined with its gameplay mechanics, make it an enjoyable and engaging experience. Whether you’re a casual or hardcore gamer, Age Of Empires II is a game worth checking out.
